info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 17 at 3:47PM CDT until June 18 at 10:31PM CDT by NWS Wichita KS
info.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Kansas...
Slate Creek At Wellington affecting Sumner and Cowley Counties.
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Kansas...
Cottonwood River near Florence affecting Marion County.
Little Arkansas River At Alta Mills affecting Harvey and Reno Counties.
Little Arkansas River Near Halstead affecting Harvey County.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Slate Creek at Wellington.
* WHEN...From late tonight to late tomorrow evening.
* IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Flood waters cover several low lying spots along Seneca Road between 40th and 60th Street just southeast of Wellington. Woods Park within the city floods. Slate Creek comes to roadway's edge at mile marker 15 on the the Kansas Turnpike.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:00 PM CDT Tuesday the stage was 12.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tonight to a crest of 21.0 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 19.0 feet.
info.instruction:
Do not drive into flooded areas or go around barricades. Nearly two feet of water will carry most vehicles away. Turn around, don't drown.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued late tonight at 400 AM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO LATE TOMORROW EVENING
